candidates.name: Jo Goodhew
candidates.why_elect: I have a reputation as a caring and accessible person and am well connected into community organisations in the district. I trained at Timaru Hospital and worked as a Registered Nurse there and in general practice. I have considerable experience in health related governance roles and volunteering within the sector.
candidates.why_stand: My whole working life has brought me into contact with healthcare provision. Our DHB has been a fiscally sound provider of health care unlike other DHBs. I do not support our DHB being merged and I will be a strong advocate for continuing this strong history of healthcare.

candidates.name: Sue Harrex
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the area for 29 years and have a background in farming, construction and general business and Director of several family companies. I have a good sense for business and I think I can offer a lot to the South Canterbury District Health Board.
candidates.why_stand: I feel I have a lot to offer the people of South Canterbury. I am on the Disability Support Advisory Committee and am heavily involved with volunteering at The Timaru Senior Citizens. I would like our elderly to be able to live well and age well in our community.

candidates.name: Gerrie Ligtenberg
candidates.why_elect: I have experience as member of a nursing advisory board, worker's council, experience with hospital amalgamation, build of a new hospital and I was a board member of a professional nursing organisation. I will bring many years of nursing experience and knowledge of our communities to this role.
candidates.why_stand: I have worked in the community mainly working with the elderly but giving equal support to their families. I have been passionate about improving health services in the communities as a nurse and now that I am recently retired I wish to continue to promote excellent health care for everyone.

candidates.name: Peter Binns
candidates.why_elect: My medical work included general practice and various specialities, with fifteen years as an Orthopaedic Surgeon at Timaru Hospital. With service of five terms on South Canterbury District Health Board, I have a clear understanding of the personnel and resources necessary for a safe, effective and inclusive Public Health Service.
candidates.why_stand: As a Medical Doctor and having lived in South Canterbury for 35 years, I am determined to continue challenging any plans that may threaten our Services locally or regionally. I seek to ensure that we have the best possible Public Health Services, here at the centre of the South Island.

candidates.name: Sam Callander
candidates.why_elect: I have the perspective needed for bold decision making; having worked throughout South Canterbury with health teams as 'Primary Health Manager' at SCDHB from 2015-2018 and with businesses while working for the economic development agency. I've served on region's YMCA and Community Trust boards. I hold a BCom in Economics.
candidates.why_stand: South Canterbury is a remarkable corner of the planet and I'm lucky to be part of the community; lucky also have worked supporting health professionals from Timaru to Twizel, from Waimate to Geraldine. They are passionate and skilled. Yet, there are huge opportunities to help their work be more effective.

candidates.name: Barbara Gilchrist
candidates.why_elect: A vote for me is a vote for a fresh voice—a voice that's backed by years of nursing in our region, an optimistic yet realistic outlook, and a deeply personal interest in the health of South Canterbury.
candidates.why_stand: From our first breath to our last, we all want to live a happy and healthy life. This means having healthcare that's close to home. I want to help our DHB provide this by promoting a healthy environment for all and making the most of every dollar.
